Sentence: The number and placement of a plant ’s leaves will vary depending on the species , with each species exhibiting a characteristic leaf arrangement .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1171 . In a simple leaf , the blade is either completely undivided — as in the banana leaf — or it has lobes , but the separation does not reach the midrib , as in the maple leaf .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In a compound leaf , the leaf blade is completely divided , forming leaflets , as in the locust tree .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Each leaflet may have its own stalk , but is attached to the rachis .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1174 . The epidermis is usually one cell layer thick ; however , in plants that grow in very hot or very cold conditions , the epidermis may be several layers thick to protect against excessive water loss from transpiration .

Subject: biology
Sentence: A waxy layer known as the cuticle covers the leaves of all plant species .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The cuticle reduces the rate of water loss from the leaf surface .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1177 . Transpiration is the loss of water from the plant through evaporation at the leaf surface .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It is the main driver of water movement in the xylem .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1180 . Structures that produce photosynthates for the growing plant are referred to as sources .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Sugars produced in sources , such as leaves , need to be delivered to growing parts of the plant via the phloem in a process called translocation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1183 . Plants have a number of sophisticated uses for light that go far beyond their ability to photosynthesize low - molecular - weight sugars using only carbon dioxide , light , and water .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Photomorphogenesis is the growth and development of plants in response to light .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It allows plants to optimize their use of light and space .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1186 . The sensing of light in the environment is important to plants ; it can be crucial for competition and survival .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The response of plants to light is mediated by different photoreceptors , which are comprised of a protein covalently bonded to a light - absorbing pigment called a chromophore .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Together , the two are called a chromoprotein .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1189 . Most activation occurs on the lit side , causing the plant hormone indole acetic acid ( IAA ) to accumulate on the shaded side .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Stem cells elongate under influence of IAA .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Cryptochromes are another class of blue - light absorbing photoreceptors that also contain a flavin - based chromophore .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Cryptochromes set the plants 24-hour activity cycle , also know as its circadian rhythem , using blue light cues .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1192 . The term auxin is derived from the Greek word auxein , which means " to grow . "

Subject: biology
Sentence: Auxins are the main hormones responsible for cell elongation in phototropism and gravitropism .

Subject: biology
Sentence: They also control the differentiation of meristem into vascular tissue , and promote leaf development and arrangement .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1195 . Gibberellins ( GAs ) are a group of about 125 closely related plant hormones that stimulate shoot elongation , seed germination , and fruit and flower maturation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: GAs are synthesized in the root and stem apical meristems , young leaves , and seed embryos .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1198 . Jasmonates play a major role in defense responses to herbivory .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Their levels increase when a plant is wounded by a predator , resulting in an increase in toxic secondary metabolites .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1201 . The movement of a plant subjected to constant directional pressure is called thigmotropism , from the Greek words thigma meaning “ touch , ” and tropism implying “ direction . ” Tendrils are one example of this .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The meristematic region of tendrils is very touch sensitive ; light touch will evoke a quick coiling response .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1204 . Plant nutrients may be composed of either organic or inorganic compounds .

Subject: biology
Sentence: An organic compound is a chemical compound that contains carbon , such as carbon dioxide obtained from the atmosphere .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Carbon that was obtained from atmospheric CO2 composes the majority of the dry mass within most plants .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1207 . The essential elements can be divided into two groups : macronutrients and micronutrients .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Nutrients that plants require in larger amounts are called macronutrients .

Subject: biology
Sentence: About half of the essential elements are considered macronutrients : carbon , hydrogen , oxygen , nitrogen , phosphorus , potassium , calcium , magnesium and sulfur .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1210 . Soil develops very slowly over long periods of time , and its formation results from natural and environmental forces acting on mineral , rock , and organic compounds .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Soils can be divided into two groups : organic soils are those that are formed from sedimentation and primarily composed of organic matter , while those that are formed from the weathering of rocks and are primarily composed of inorganic material are called mineral soils .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Mineral soils are predominant in terrestrial ecosystems , where soils may be covered by water for part of the year or exposed to the atmosphere .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1216 . Within the soil profile , soil scientists define zones called horizons .

Subject: biology
Sentence: A horizon is a soil layer with distinct physical and chemical properties that differ from those of other layers .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Five factors account for soil formation : parent material , climate , topography , biological factors , and time . Parent Material

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1219 . Animals and microorganisms can produce pores and crevices , and plant roots can penetrate into crevices to produce more fragmentation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Plant secretions promote the development of microorganisms around the root , in an area known as the rhizosphere .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Additionally , leaves and other material that fall from plants decompose and contribute to soil composition .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1222 . In this area , rainwater percolates through the soil and carries materials from the surface .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The B horizon is an accumulation of mostly fine material that has moved downward , resulting in a dense layer in the soil .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In some soils , the B horizon contains nodules or a layer of calcium carbonate .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1225 . Soil bacteria , collectively called rhizobia , symbiotically interact with legume roots to form specialized structures called nodules , in which nitrogen fixation takes place .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This process entails the reduction of atmospheric nitrogen to ammonia , by means of the enzyme nitrogenase .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Therefore , using rhizobia is a natural and environmentally friendly way to fertilize plants , as opposed to chemical fertilization that uses a nonrenewable resource , such as natural gas .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1228 . A symbiont is a plant in a symbiotic relationship , with special adaptations such as mycorrhizae or nodule formation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Fungi also form symbiotic associations with cyanobacteria and green algae ( called lichens ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1231 . Plants have two distinct stages in their lifecycle : the gametophyte stage and the sporophyte stage .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The haploid gametophyte produces the male and female gametes by mitosis in distinct multicellular structures .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Fusion of the male and females gametes forms the diploid zygote , which develops into the sporophyte .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1234 . The third whorl contains the male reproductive structures and is known as the androecium .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The androecium has stamens with anthers that contain the microsporangia .

Sentence: The innermost group of structures in the flower is the gynoecium , or the female reproductive component(s ) .

During the second phase , megagametogenesis , the surviving haploid megaspore undergoes mitosis to produce an eight - nucleate , seven - cell female gametophyte , also known as the megagametophyte or embryo sac . Two of the nuclei — the polar nuclei — move to the equator and fuse , forming a single , diploid central cell .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This central cell later fuses with a sperm to form the triploid endosperm .

Sentence: The integuments , while protecting the megasporangium , do not enclose it completely , but leave an opening called the micropyle .

Subject: biology

Sentence: In gymnosperms , pollination involves pollen transfer from the male cone to the female cone .

Subject: biology

Sentence: The pollen sticks to the bees ’ fuzzy hair , and when the bee visits another flower , some of the pollen is transferred to the second flower .

Sentence: The suspensor provides a route for nutrition to be transported from the mother plant to the growing embryo .

Subject: biology

Subject: biology

Subject: biology
Sentence: Presoaking in hot water , or passing through an acid environment , such as an animal ’s digestive tract , may also be employed .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1270 . An aggregate fruit is one that develops from more than one carpel , but all are in the same flower : the mature carpels fuse together to form the entire fruit , as seen in the raspberry .

Subject: biology
Sentence: An example is the pineapple , where the flowers fuse together to form the fruit .

Subject: biology

Sentence: Together , all three are known as the pericarp .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The mesocarp is usually the fleshy , edible part of the fruit ; however , in some fruits , such as the almond , the endocarp is the edible part .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1276 . In grafting , two plant species are used ; part of the stem of the desirable plant is grafted onto a rooted plant called the stock .

Sentence: The part that is grafted or attached is called the scion .

Sentence: Both are cut at an oblique angle ( any angle other than a right angle ) , placed in close contact with each other , and are then held together [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1279 . Micropropagation ( also called plant tissue culture ) is a method of propagating a large number of plants from a single plant in a short time under laboratory conditions [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This method allows propagation of rare , endangered species that may be difficult to grow under natural conditions , are economically important , or are in demand as disease - free plants .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1282 . The aging of a plant and all the associated processes is known as senescence , which is marked by several complex biochemical changes .

Sentence: One of the characteristics of senescence is the breakdown of chloroplasts , which is characterized by the yellowing of leaves .

Sentence: 1285 . This is fused to the animal ’s epidermis .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1288 . Carbohydrates and proteins contain about 4.5 to 5 kcal / g , and fat contains about 9 kcal / g .

Sentence: Metabolic rate is estimated as the basal metabolic rate ( BMR ) in endothermic animals at rest and as the standard metabolic rate ( SMR ) in ectotherms .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Human males have a BMR of 1600 to 1800 kcal / day , and human females have a BMR of 1300 to 1500 kcal / day .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1291 . Torpor can be used by animals for long periods , such as entering a state of hibernation during the winter months , in which case it enables them to maintain a reduced body temperature .

Subject: biology
Sentence: During hibernation , ground squirrels can achieve an abdominal temperature of 0 ° C ( 32 ° F ) , while a bear ’s internal temperature is maintained higher at about 37 ° C ( 99 ° F ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: If torpor occurs during the summer months with high temperatures and little water , it is called estivation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Some desert animals use this to survive the harshest months of the year .

Subject: biology
Sentence: A frontal plane ( also called a coronal plane ) separates the front from the back .

Subject: biology
Sentence: A transverse plane ( or , horizontal plane ) divides the animal into upper and lower portions .

Subject: biology

Subject: biology
Sentence: The ventral cavity contains the thoracic cavity , which in turn contains the pleural cavity around the lungs and the pericardial cavity , which surrounds the heart .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The ventral cavity also contains the abdominopelvic cavity , which can be separated into the abdominal and the pelvic cavities .

Subject: biology

Sentence: The cell outline is slightly irregular , and cells fit together to form a covering or lining .

Sentence: This cellular covering has cilia at the apical , or free , surface of the cells .

Sentence: 1306 . Some tissues have specialized cells that are not found in the others .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The matrix in connective tissues gives the tissue its density .

Subject: biology
Sentence: When a connective tissue has a high concentration of cells or fibers , it has proportionally a less dense matrix .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1309 . Cartilage is a connective tissue with a large amount of the matrix and variable amounts of fibers .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The cells , called chondrocytes , make the matrix and fibers of the tissue .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1312 . Compact bone is found in the shaft ( or diaphysis ) of a long bone and the surface of the flat bones , while spongy bone is found in the end ( or epiphysis ) of a long bone .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Compact bone is organized into subunits called osteons , as illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: A blood vessel and a nerve are found in the center of the structure within the Haversian canal , with radiating circles of lacunae around it known as lamellae .

Sentence: 1315 . These changes might be in the level of glucose or calcium in blood or in external temperatures .

Sentence: Homeostasis means to maintain dynamic equilibrium in the body .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It is dynamic because it is constantly adjusting to the changes that the body ’s systems encounter .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1318 . Positive Feedback Loop

Subject: biology
Sentence: A positive feedback loop maintains the direction of the stimulus , possibly accelerating it .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Few examples of positive feedback loops exist in animal bodies , but one is found in the cascade of chemical reactions that result in blood clotting , or coagulation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1324 . Omnivores are animals that eat both plant- and animal- derived food .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In Latin , omnivore means to eat everything .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1327 . As the word monogastric suggests , this type of digestive system consists of one ( “ mono ” ) stomach chamber ( “ gastric ” ) .

Sentence: Humans and many animals have a monogastric digestive system as illustrated in [ link ] a b .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1330 . Saliva also contains immunoglobulins and lysozymes , which have antibacterial action to reduce tooth decay by inhibiting growth of some bacteria .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Saliva also contains an enzyme called salivary amylase that begins the process of converting starches in the food into a disaccharide called maltose .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Another enzyme called lipase is produced by the cells in the tongue .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The chewed and softened food passes through the esophagus after being swallowed .

Sentence: The human large intestine is much smaller in length compared to the small intestine but larger in diameter .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1351 . Essential NutrientsWhile the animal body can synthesize many of the molecules required for function from the organic precursors , there are some nutrients that need to be consumed from food .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These nutrients are termed essential nutrients , meaning they must be eaten , and the body can not produce them .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1354 . Food needs to be broken into smaller particles so that animals can harness the nutrients and organic molecules .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The first step in this process is ingestion .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Ingestion is the process of taking in food through the mouth .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1357 . The enzyme pepsin plays an important role in the digestion of proteins by breaking down the intact protein to peptides , which are short chains of four to nine amino acids .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In the duodenum , other enzymes — trypsin , elastase , and chymotrypsin — act on the peptides reducing them to smaller peptides .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Trypsin elastase , carboxypeptidase , and chymotrypsin are produced by the pancreas and released into the duodenum where they act on the chyme .

Sentence: 1360 . The response to food begins even before food enters the mouth .

Subject: biology
Sentence: All aspects — such as sight , sense , and smell — trigger the neural responses resulting in salivation and secretion of gastric juices .

Sentence: 1363 . The endocrine system controls the response of the various glands in the body and the release of hormones at the appropriate times .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Secretin acts in tandem with another hormone called cholecystokinin ( CCK ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1369 . The nervous system is made up of neurons , specialized cells that can receive and transmit chemical or electrical signals , and glia , cells that provide support functions for the neurons by playing an information processing role that is complementary to neurons .

Subject: biology
Sentence: A neuron can be compared to an electrical wire — it transmits a signal from one place to another .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1372 . The cell body contains a specialized structure , the axon hillock that integrates signals from multiple synapses and serves as a junction between the cell body and an axon .

Subject: biology
Sentence: An axon is a tube - like structure that propagates the integrated signal to specialized endings called axon terminals .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These terminals in turn synapse on other neurons , muscle , or target organs .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1375 . There are several different types of glia with different functions , two of which are shown in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Astrocytes , shown in [ link ] a make contact with both capillaries and neurons in the CNS .

Subject: biology
Sentence: They provide nutrients and other substances to neurons , regulate the concentrations of ions and chemicals in the extracellular fluid , and provide structural support for synapses .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1378 . Microglia scavenge and degrade dead cells and protect the brain from invading microorganisms .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Oligodendrocytes , shown in [ link ] b form myelin sheaths around axons in the CNS .

Subject: biology
Sentence: One axon can be myelinated by several oligodendrocytes , and one oligodendrocyte can provide myelin for multiple neurons .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1381 . Radial glia serve as scaffolds for developing neurons as they migrate to their end destinations .

Sentence: Ependymal cells line fluid - filled ventricles of the brain and the central canal of the spinal cord .

Sentence: They are involved in the production of cerebrospinal fluid , which serves as a cushion for the brain , moves the fluid between the spinal cord and the brain , and is a component for the choroid plexus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1384 . When neurotransmitter molecules bind to receptors located on a neuron ’s dendrites , ion channels open .

Subject: biology
Sentence: At excitatory synapses , this opening allows positive ions to enter the neuron and results in depolarization of the membrane — a decrease in the difference in voltage between the inside and outside of the neuron .

Sentence: A stimulus from a sensory cell or another neuron depolarizes the target neuron to its threshold potential ( -55 mV ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1387 . Flow of ions through these channels , particularly the Na+ channels , regenerates the action potential over and over again along the axon .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This ‘ jumping ’ of the action potential from one node to the next is called saltatory conduction .

Subject: biology
Sentence: If nodes of Ranvier were not present along an axon , the action potential would propagate very slowly since Na+ and K+ channels would have to continuously regenerate action potentials at every point along the axon instead of at specific points .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1390 . Na+ enters the postsynaptic cell and causes the postsynaptic membrane to depolarize .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This depolarization is called an excitatory postsynaptic potential ( EPSP ) and makes the postsynaptic neuron more likely to fire an action potential .

Sentence: 1393 . Long - term potentiation ( LTP ) is a persistent strengthening of a synaptic connection .

Sentence: LTP is based on the Hebbian principle : cells that fire together wire together .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1396 . The central nervous system ( CNS ) is made up of the brain , a part of which is shown in [ link ] and spinal cord and is covered with three layers of protective coverings called meninges ( from the Greek word for membrane ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The outermost layer is the dura mater ( Latin for “ hard mother ” ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: As the Latin suggests , the primary function for this thick layer is to protect the brain and spinal cord .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1399 . The last layer is the pia mater ( Latin for “ soft mother ” ) , which directly contacts and covers the brain and spinal cord like plastic wrap .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The space between the arachnoid and pia maters is filled with cerebrospinal fluid ( CSF ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: CSF is produced by a tissue called choroid plexus in fluid - filled compartments in the CNS called ventricles .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1402 . The cortex is made up of two hemispheres — right and left — which are separated by a large sulcus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: A thick fiber bundle called the corpus callosum ( Latin : “ tough body ” ) connects the two hemispheres and allows information to be passed from one side to the other .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Although there are some brain functions that are localized more to one hemisphere than the other , the functions of the two hemispheres are largely redundant .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1405 . Neurons in the parietal lobe are involved in speech and also reading .

Subject: biology

Sentence: Muscle spindles are stretch receptors that detect the amount of stretch , or lengthening of muscles .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Related to these are Golgi tendon organs , which are tension receptors that detect the force of muscle contraction .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Proprioceptive and kinesthetic signals come from limbs .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1450 . Dogs detect up to about 40,000 Hz ; cats , 60,000 Hz ; bats , 100,000 Hz ; and dolphins 150,000 Hz , and American shad ( Alosa sapidissima ) , a fish , can hear 180,000 Hz .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Those frequencies above the human range are called ultrasound . Amplitude , or the dimension of a wave from peak to trough , in sound is heard as volume and is illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The sound waves of louder sounds have greater amplitude than those of softer sounds .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1453 . Interior to the tympanum is the middle ear .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The middle ear holds three small bones called the ossicles , which transfer energy from the moving tympanum to the inner ear .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The three ossicles are the malleus ( also known as the hammer ) , the incus ( the anvil ) , and stapes ( the stirrup ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1456 . The stapes transmits the vibrations to a thin diaphragm called the oval window , which is the outermost structure of the inner ear .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The structures of the inner ear are found in the labyrinth , a bony , hollow structure that is the most interior portion of the ear .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Here , the energy from the sound wave is transferred from the stapes through the flexible oval window and to the fluid of the cochlea .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1459 . When the sound waves in the cochlear fluid contact the basilar membrane , it flexes back and forth in a wave - like fashion .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Above the basilar membrane is the tectorial membrane .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1462 . The fluid - filled semicircular canals are tubular loops set at oblique angles .

Subject: biology
Sentence: They are arranged in three spatial planes .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1465 . The photoreceptive cells of the eye , where transduction of light to nervous impulses occurs , are located in the retina ( shown in [ link ] ) on the inner surface of the back of the eye .

Subject: biology
Sentence: But light does not impinge on the retina unaltered .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1468 . The lens is operated by muscles that stretch it flat or allow it to thicken , changing the focal length of light coming through it to focus it sharply on the retina .

Subject: biology
Sentence: With age comes the loss of the flexibility of the lens , and a form of farsightedness called presbyopia results .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Presbyopia occurs because the image focuses behind the retina .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1471 . There are two types of photoreceptors in the retina : rods and cones , named for their general appearance as illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Rods are strongly photosensitive and are located in the outer edges of the retina .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1474 . Photoreceptors in the retina continuously undergo tonic activity .

Subject: biology
Sentence: That is , they are always slightly active even when not stimulated by light .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1477 . Finally , there is the pathway from the retina to the suprachiasmatic nucleus ( SCN ) of the hypothalamus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The SCN is a cluster of cells that is considered to be the body ’s internal clock , which controls our circadian ( day - long ) cycle .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The SCN sends information to the pineal gland , which is important in sleep / wake patterns and annual cycles .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1480 . Odorants ( odor molecules ) enter the nose and dissolve in the olfactory epithelium , the mucosa at the back of the nasal cavity ( as illustrated in [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The olfactory epithelium is a collection of specialized olfactory receptors in the back of the nasal cavity that spans an area about 5 cm2 in humans .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1483 . Olfactory neurons are bipolar neurons ( neurons with two processes from the cell body ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Each neuron has a single dendrite buried in the olfactory epithelium , and extending from this dendrite are 5 to 20 receptor - laden , hair - like cilia that trap odorant molecules .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1486 . These are elongated cells with hair - like processes called microvilli at the tips that extend into the taste bud pore ( illustrate in [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Food molecules ( tastants ) are dissolved in saliva , and they bind with and stimulate the receptors on the microvilli .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The receptors for tastants are located across the outer portion and front of the tongue , outside of the middle area where the filiform papillae are most prominent .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1489 . Chemically , these hormones are usually ketones or alcohols ; their chemical names will end in “ -ol ” for alcohols or “ -one ” for ketones .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Examples of steroid hormones include estradiol , which is an estrogen , or female sex hormone , and testosterone , which is an androgen , or male sex hormone .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These two hormones are released by the female and male reproductive organs , respectively .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1492 . Hormones mediate changes in target cells by binding to specific hormone receptors .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In this way , even though hormones circulate throughout the body and come into contact with many different cell types , they only affect cells that possess the necessary receptors .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1495 . Receptor binding alters cellular activity and results in an increase or decrease in normal body processes .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Depending on the location of the protein receptor on the target cell and the chemical structure of the hormone , hormones can mediate changes directly by binding to intracellular hormone receptors and modulating gene transcription , or indirectly by binding to cell surface receptors and stimulating signaling pathways .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1498 . One very important second messenger is cyclic AMP ( cAMP ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: When a hormone binds to its membrane receptor , a G - protein that is associated with the receptor is activated ; G - proteins are proteins separate from receptors that are found in the cell membrane .

Subject: biology
Sentence: When a hormone is not bound to the receptor , the G - protein is inactive and is bound to guanosine diphosphate , or GDP .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1501 . The term “ humoral ” is derived from the term “ humor , ” which refers to bodily fluids such as blood .

Subject: biology
Sentence: A humoral stimulus refers to the control of hormone release in response to changes in extracellular fluids such as blood or the ion concentration in the blood .

Subject: biology
Sentence: For example , a rise in blood glucose levels triggers the pancreatic release of insulin .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1504 . Because the neurons can regulate the release of hormones , the nervous and endocrine systems work in a coordinated manner to regulate the body 's physiology .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Hypothalamic - Pituitary AxisThe hypothalamus in vertebrates integrates the endocrine and nervous systems .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The hypothalamus is an endocrine organ located in the diencephalon of the brain .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1507 . The anterior pituitary gland , or adenohypophysis , is surrounded by a capillary network that extends from the hypothalamus , down along the infundibulum , and to the anterior pituitary .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This capillary network is a part of the hypophyseal portal system that carries substances from the hypothalamus to the anterior pituitary and hormones from the anterior pituitary into the circulatory system .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1510 . The thyroid gland is located in the neck , just below the larynx and in front of the trachea , as shown in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It is a butterfly - shaped gland with two lobes that are connected by the isthmus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1513 . Follicle cells are stimulated to release stored T3 and T4 by thyroid stimulating hormone ( TSH ) , which is produced by the anterior pituitary .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These thyroid hormones increase the rates of mitochondrial ATP production .

Sentence: A third hormone , calcitonin , is produced by parafollicular cells of the thyroid either releasing hormones or inhibiting hormones .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Calcitonin release is not controlled by TSH , but instead is released when calcium ion concentrations in the blood rise .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1516 . The adrenal cortex is made up of layers of epithelial cells and associated capillary networks .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These layers form three distinct regions : an outer zona glomerulosa that produces mineralocorticoids , a middle zona fasciculata that produces glucocorticoids , and an inner zona reticularis that produces androgens .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1519 . The endocrine cells of the pancreas form clusters called pancreatic islets or the islets of Langerhans , as visible in the micrograph shown in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The pancreatic islets contain two primary cell types : alpha cells , which produce the hormone glucagon , and beta cells , which produce the hormone insulin .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1522 . While the adrenal glands associated with the kidneys are major endocrine glands , the kidneys themselves also possess endocrine function .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Renin is released in response to decreased blood volume or pressure and is part of the renin - angiotensin - aldosterone system that leads to the release of aldosterone .

Subject: biology

Sentence: Chronic underproduction of ADH or a mutation in the ADH receptor results in diabetes insipidus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: If the posterior pituitary does not release enough ADH , water can not be retained by the kidneys and is lost as urine .

Subject: biology

Subject: biology
Sentence: LH stimulates production of the sex hormones ( androgens ) by the interstitial cells of the testes and therefore is also called interstitial cell - stimulating hormone .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1537 . Prolactin levels are regulated by the hypothalamic hormones prolactin - releasing hormone ( PRH ) and prolactin - inhibiting hormone ( PIH ) , which is now known to be dopamine .

Subject: biology
Sentence: PRH stimulates the release of prolactin and PIH inhibits it . The posterior pituitary releases the hormone oxytocin , which stimulates uterine contractions during childbirth .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The uterine smooth muscles are not very sensitive to oxytocin until late in pregnancy when the number of oxytocin receptors in the uterus peaks .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1540 . This can be caused by low levels of insulin production by the beta cells of the pancreas , or by reduced sensitivity of tissue cells to insulin .

Sentence: This prevents glucose from being absorbed by cells , causing high levels of blood glucose , or hyperglycemia ( high sugar ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: High blood glucose levels make it difficult for the kidneys to recover all the glucose from nascent urine , resulting in glucose being lost in urine .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1543 . When blood glucose levels decline below normal levels , for example between meals or when glucose is utilized rapidly during exercise , the hormone glucagon is released from the alpha cells of the pancreas .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Glucagon raises blood glucose levels , eliciting what is called a hyperglycemic effect , by stimulating the breakdown of glycogen to glucose in skeletal muscle cells and liver cells in a process called glycogenolysis .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Glucose can then be utilized as energy by muscle cells and released into circulation by the liver cells .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1546 . T3 and T4 release from the thyroid gland is stimulated by thyroid - stimulating hormone ( TSH ) , which is produced by the anterior pituitary .

Subject: biology
Sentence: TSH binding at the receptors of the follicle of the thyroid triggers the production of T3 and T4 from a glycoprotein called thyroglobulin .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1549 . Disorders can arise from both the underproduction and overproduction of thyroid hormones .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Hypothyroidism , underproduction of the thyroid hormones , can cause a low metabolic rate leading to weight gain , sensitivity to cold , and reduced mental activity , among other symptoms .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In children , hypothyroidism can cause cretinism , which can lead to mental retardation and growth defects .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1552 . The hormone calcitonin , which is produced by the parafollicular or C cells of the thyroid , has the opposite effect on blood calcium levels as does PTH .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Calcitonin decreases blood calcium levels by inhibiting osteoclasts , stimulating osteoblasts , and stimulating calcium excretion by the kidneys .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1555 . Blood glucose levels increase as most tissues are utilizing fatty acids instead of glucose for their energy needs .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The GH mediated increase in blood glucose levels is called a diabetogenic effect because it is similar to the high blood glucose levels seen in diabetes mellitus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The indirect mechanism of GH action is mediated by insulin - like growth factors ( IGFs ) or somatomedins , which are a family of growth - promoting proteins produced by the liver , which stimulates tissue growth .

Subject: biology
Sentence: IGFs stimulate the uptake of amino acids from the blood , allowing the formation of new proteins , particularly in skeletal muscle cells , cartilage cells , and other target cells , as shown in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1558 . In some cases , individuals are under 30 inches in height .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Oversecretion of growth hormone can lead to gigantism in children , causing excessive growth .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In some documented cases , individuals can reach heights of over eight feet .

Sentence: 1561 . Stressful stimuli cause the hypothalamus to signal the adrenal medulla ( which mediates short - term stress responses ) via nerve impulses , and the adrenal cortex , which mediates long - term stress responses , via the hormone adrenocorticotropic hormone ( ACTH ) , which is produced by the anterior pituitary .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Short - term Stress ResponseWhen presented with a stressful situation , the body responds by calling for the release of hormones that provide a burst of energy .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The hormones epinephrine ( also known as adrenaline ) and norepinephrine ( also known as noradrenaline ) are released by the adrenal medulla .

Sentence: How do these hormones provide a burst of energy ?

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1567 . FSH stimulates egg maturation in females , while LH stimulates the production of estrogens and progesterone .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Estrogens are a group of steroid hormones produced by the ovaries that trigger the development of secondary sex characteristics in females as well as control the maturation of the ova .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In females , the pituitary also produces prolactin , which stimulates milk production after childbirth , and oxytocin , which stimulates uterine contraction during childbirth and milk let - down during suckling .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Insulin is produced by the pancreas in response to rising blood glucose levels and allows cells to utilize blood glucose and store excess glucose for later use .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1570 . An endoskeleton is a skeleton that consists of hard , mineralized structures located within the soft tissue of organisms .

Subject: biology
Sentence: An example of a primitive endoskeletal structure is the spicules of sponges .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1573 . The skull consists of 22 bones , which are divided into two categories : cranial bones and facial bones .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The cranial bones are eight bones that form the cranial cavity , which encloses the brain and serves as an attachment site for the muscles of the head and neck .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The eight cranial bones are the frontal bone , two parietal bones , two temporal bones , occipital bone , sphenoid bone , and the ethmoid bone .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1576 . Although it is not found in the skull , the hyoid bone is considered a component of the axial skeleton .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The hyoid bone lies below the mandible in the front of the neck .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It acts as a movable base for the tongue and is connected to muscles of the jaw , larynx , and tongue .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1579 . The thoracic cage , also known as the ribcage , is the skeleton of the chest , and consists of the ribs , sternum , thoracic vertebrae , and costal cartilages ( [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The thoracic cage encloses and protects the organs of the thoracic cavity , including the heart and lungs .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1582 . The appendicular skeleton is composed of the bones of the upper limbs ( which function to grasp and manipulate objects ) and the lower limbs ( which permit locomotion ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It also includes the pectoral girdle , or shoulder girdle , that attaches the upper limbs to the body , and the pelvic girdle that attaches the lower limbs to the body ( [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1585 . The scapulae are flat , triangular bones that are located at the back of the pectoral girdle .

Subject: biology
Sentence: They support the muscles crossing the shoulder joint .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1588 . It articulates with the scapula at the shoulder and with the forearm at the elbow .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The forearm extends from the elbow to the wrist and consists of two bones : the ulna and the radius .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The radius is located along the lateral ( thumb ) side of the forearm and articulates with the humerus at the elbow .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1591 . The radius and ulna also articulate with the carpal bones and with each other , which in vertebrates enables a variable degree of rotation of the carpus with respect to the long axis of the limb .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The hand includes the eight bones of the carpus ( wrist ) , the five bones of the metacarpus ( palm ) , and the 14 bones of the phalanges ( digits ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Each digit consists of three phalanges , except for the thumb , when present , which has only two .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1594 . The lower limb consists of the thigh , the leg , and the foot .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The bones of the lower limb are the femur ( thigh bone ) , patella ( kneecap ) , tibia and fibula ( bones of the leg ) , tarsals ( bones of the ankle ) , and metatarsals and phalanges ( bones of the foot ) ( [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1597 . It improves knee extension by reducing friction .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The tibia , or shinbone , is a large bone of the leg that is located directly below the knee .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The tibia articulates with the femur at its proximal end , with the fibula and the tarsal bones at its distal end .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1600 . The ankle transmits the weight of the body from the tibia and the fibula to the foot .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The metatarsals are the five bones of the foot .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The phalanges are the 14 bones of the toes .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1603 . There are three types of fibrous joints : sutures , syndesmoses , and gomphoses .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Sutures are found only in the skull and possess short fibers of connective tissue that hold the skull bones tightly in place ( [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1606 . Cartilaginous joints are joints in which the bones are connected by cartilage .

Subject: biology
Sentence: There are two types of cartilaginous joints : synchondroses and symphyses .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1609 . Synovial joints are the only joints that have a space between the adjoining bones ( [ link ] ) . This space is referred to as the synovial ( or joint ) cavity and is filled with synovial fluid .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1612 . Amphiarthroses are joints that allow slight movement , including syndesmoses and symphyses .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Diarthroses are joints that allow for free movement of the joint , as in synovial joints .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1615 . There are several different types of angular movements , including flexion , extension , hyperextension , abduction , adduction , and circumduction .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Flexion , or bending , occurs when the angle between the bones decreases .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Moving the forearm upward at the elbow or moving the wrist to move the hand toward the forearm are examples of flexion .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1618 . Abduction occurs when a bone moves away from the midline of the body .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Examples of abduction are moving the arms or legs laterally to lift them straight out to the side .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1621 . Rotational movement is the movement of a bone as it rotates around its longitudinal axis .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Rotation can be toward the midline of the body , which is referred to as medial rotation , or away from the midline of the body , which is referred to as lateral rotation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1624 . Inversion involves the soles of the feet moving inward , toward the midline of the body .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Eversion is the opposite of inversion , movement of the sole of the foot outward , away from the midline of the body .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Protraction is the anterior movement of a bone in the horizontal plane .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1627 . Protraction and retraction can be seen in the movement of the mandible as the jaw is thrust outwards and then back inwards .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Elevation is the movement of a bone upward , such as when the shoulders are shrugged , lifting the scapulae .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Depression is the opposite of elevation — movement downward of a bone , such as after the shoulders are shrugged and the scapulae return to their normal position from an elevated position .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1630 . Dorsiflexion is a bending at the ankle such that the toes are lifted toward the knee .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Plantar flexion is a bending at the ankle when the heel is lifted , such as when standing on the toes .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Supination is the movement of the radius and ulna bones of the forearm so that the palm faces forward .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1633 . Pronation is the opposite movement , in which the palm faces backward .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Opposition is the movement of the thumb toward the fingers of the same hand , making it possible to grasp and hold objects .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1636 . Pivot joints consist of the rounded end of one bone fitting into a ring formed by the other bone .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This structure allows rotational movement , as the rounded bone moves around its own axis .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1639 . Ball - and - Socket JointsBall - and - socket joints possess a rounded , ball - like end of one bone fitting into a cuplike socket of another bone .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This organization allows the greatest range of motion , as all movement types are possible in all directions .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1642 . Smooth muscle tissue occurs in the walls of hollow organs such as the intestines , stomach , and urinary bladder , and around passages such as the respiratory tract and blood vessels .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Smooth muscle has no striations , is not under voluntary control , has only one nucleus per cell , is tapered at both ends , and is called involuntary muscle .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1645 . The sarcolemma is the site of action potential conduction , which triggers muscle contraction .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Within each muscle fiber are myofibrils — long cylindrical structures that lie parallel to the muscle fiber .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Myofibrils run the entire length of the muscle fiber , and because they are only approximately 1.2 µm in diameter , hundreds to thousands can be found inside one muscle fiber .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1648 . There are two main types of filaments : thick filaments and thin filaments ; each has different compositions and locations .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Thick filaments occur only in the A band of a myofibril .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Thin filaments attach to a protein in the Z disc called alpha - actinin and occur across the entire length of the I band and partway into the A band .

Subject: biology

Subject: biology

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1654 . Bone , or osseous tissue , is a connective tissue that constitutes the endoskeleton .

Sentence: It contains specialized cells and a matrix of mineral salts and collagen fibers .

Subject: biology

Subject: biology
Sentence: The rounded ends , the epiphyses , are covered with articular cartilage and are filled with red bone marrow , which produces blood cells ( [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1660 . Flat bones are thin and relatively broad bones that are found where extensive protection of organs is required or where broad surfaces of muscle attachment are required .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Examples of flat bones are the sternum ( breast bone ) , ribs , scapulae ( shoulder blades ) , and the roof of the skull ( [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1663 . Sutural bones are small , flat , irregularly shaped bones .

Sentence: They may be found between the flat bones of the skull .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1666 . They are aligned parallel to the long axis of the bone .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The Haversian canal ( osteonic canal ) contains the bone ’s blood vessels and nerve fibers ( [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1669 . Spongy bone tissue does not contain osteons that constitute compact bone tissue .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Instead , it consists of trabeculae , which are lamellae that are arranged as rods or plates .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Red bone marrow is found between the trabuculae .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1672 . Bone may also be resorbed for remodeling , if the applied stresses have changed .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Osteocytes are mature bone cells and are the main cells in bony connective tissue ; these cells can not divide .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Osteocytes maintain normal bone structure by recycling the mineral salts in the bony matrix .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1675 . Intramembranous ossification is the process of bone development from fibrous membranes .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It is involved in the formation of the flat bones of the skull , the mandible , and the clavicles .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1678 . Appositional growth is the increase in the diameter of bones by the addition of bony tissue at the surface of bones .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Osteoblasts at the bone surface secrete bone matrix , and osteoclasts on the inner surface break down bone .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1681 . From the nasal cavity , air passes through the pharynx ( throat ) and the larynx ( voice box ) , as it makes its way to the trachea ( [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The main function of the trachea is to funnel the inhaled air to the lungs and the exhaled air back out of the body .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1684 . In the lungs , air is diverted into smaller and smaller passages , or bronchi .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Air enters the lungs through the two primary ( main ) bronchi ( singular : bronchus ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Each bronchus divides into secondary bronchi , then into tertiary bronchi , which in turn divide , creating smaller and smaller diameter bronchioles as they split and spread through the lung .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1687 . They lack cartilage and therefore rely on inhaled air to support their shape .

Subject: biology
Sentence: As the passageways decrease in diameter , the relative amount of smooth muscle increases .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The terminal bronchioles subdivide into microscopic branches called respiratory bronchioles .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The respiratory bronchioles subdivide into several alveolar ducts .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1690 . The air that organisms breathe contains particulate matter such as dust , dirt , viral particles , and bacteria that can damage the lungs or trigger allergic immune responses .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The respiratory system contains several protective mechanisms to avoid problems or tissue damage .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1693 . At maximal capacity , an average lung can hold almost six liters of air , but lungs do not usually operate at maximal capacity .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Air in the lungs is measured in terms of lung volumes and lung capacities ( [ link ] and [ link ] ) .

Sentence: 1696 . It is the reserve amount that can be exhaled beyond what is normal .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Conversely , the inspiratory reserve volume ( IRV ) is the additional amount of air that can be inhaled after a normal inhalation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The residual volume ( RV ) is the amount of air that is left after expiratory reserve volume is exhaled .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1699 . It is the sum of the expiratory reserve volume , tidal volume , and inspiratory reserve volume .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The inspiratory capacity ( IC ) is the amount of air that can be inhaled after the end of a normal expiration .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It is , therefore , the sum of the tidal volume and inspiratory reserve volume .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1702 . Lung volumes are measured by a technique called spirometry .

Subject: biology

Sentence: In both diseases , the airways are less compliant and they are stiff or fibrotic .

Sentence: 981 . Phylum Cnidaria includes animals that show radial or biradial symmetry and are diploblastic , that is , they develop from two embryonic layers . Nearly all ( about 99 percent ) cnidarians are marine species .

Sentence: 984 . Click here to follow the life cycle of the Obelia .

Subject: biology
Sentence: All cnidarians show the presence of two membrane layers in the body that are derived from the endoderm and ectoderm of the embryo .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The outer layer ( from ectoderm ) is called the epidermis and lines the outside of the animal , whereas the inner layer ( from endoderm ) is called the gastrodermis and lines the digestive cavity .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Between these two membrane layers is a non - living , jelly - like mesoglea connective layer .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 987 . The cnidarians perform extracellular digestion in which the food is taken into the gastrovascular cavity , enzymes are secreted into the cavity , and the cells lining the cavity absorb nutrients .

Sentence: The gastrovascular cavity has only one opening that serves as both a mouth and an anus , which is termed an incomplete digestive system .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Cnidarian cells exchange oxygen and carbon dioxide by diffusion between cells in the epidermis with water in the environment , and between cells in the gastrodermis with water in the gastrovascular cavity .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 990 . This is called protostomy or “ first mouth . ”

Sentence: In protostomy , solid groups of cells split from the endoderm or inner germ layer to form a central mesodermal layer of cells .

Sentence: This layer multiplies into a band and then splits internally to form the coelom ; this protostomic coelom is hence termed schizocoelom .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 993 . The Nemertea are colloquially known as ribbon worms .

Sentence: 1023 . Phylum EchinodermataEchinodermata are so named owing to their spiny skin ( from the Greek “ echinos ” meaning “ spiny ” and “ dermos ” meaning “ skin ” ) , and this phylum is a collection of about 7,000 described living species .

Subject: biology

Sentence: In some groups , some of these traits are present only during embryonic development .

Subject: biology

Sentence: In chordates , it is located dorsal to the notochord .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1032 . The post - anal tail is a posterior elongation of the body , extending beyond the anus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The tail contains skeletal elements and muscles , which provide a source of locomotion in aquatic species , such as fishes .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1035 . Extant members of Cephalochordata are the lancelets , named for their blade - like shape .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1038 . Vertebrates are members of the clade Vertebrata .

Sentence: Vertebrates display the four characteristic features of the chordates ; however , members of this group also share derived characteristics that distinguish them from invertebrate chordates .

Subject: biology

Sentence: They create a smooth , aerodynamic surface so that air moves smoothly over the bird ’s body , allowing for efficient flight .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1116 . Plant tissue systems fall into one of two general types : meristematic tissue , and permanent ( or non - meristematic ) tissue .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Cells of the meristematic tissue are found in meristems , which are plant regions of continuous cell division and growth .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Meristematic tissue cells are either undifferentiated or incompletely differentiated , and they continue to divide and contribute to the growth of the plant .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1119 . Meristematic tissues consist of three types , based on their location in the plant .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Apical meristems contain meristematic tissue located at the tips of stems and roots , which enable a plant to extend in length .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Lateral meristems facilitate growth in thickness or girth in a maturing plant .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1122 . They differentiate into three main types : dermal , vascular , and ground tissue .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Dermal tissue covers and protects the plant , and vascular tissue transports water , minerals , and sugars to different parts of the plant .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Ground tissue serves as a site for photosynthesis , provides a supporting matrix for the vascular tissue , and helps to store water and sugars .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1125 . Plant stems , whether above or below ground , are characterized by the presence of nodes and internodes ( [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Nodes are points of attachment for leaves , aerial roots , and flowers .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The stem region between two nodes is called an internode .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1128 . An axillary bud is usually found in the axil — the area between the base of a leaf and the stem — where it can give rise to a branch or a flower .

Sentence: The apex ( tip ) of the shoot contains the apical meristem within the apical bud .

Sentence: There are two types of sclerenchyma cells : fibers and sclereids .

Sentence: Tracheids are xylem cells with thick secondary cell walls that are lignified .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1140 . Although still alive at maturity , the nucleus and other cell components of the sieve - tube cells have disintegrated .

Sentence: Companion cells are found alongside the sieve - tube cells , providing them with metabolic support .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The companion cells contain more ribosomes and mitochondria than the sieve - tube cells , which lack some cellular organelles .

Sentence: 1146 . Some plant species have modified stems that are especially suited to a particular habitat and environment ( [ link ] ) .

Sentence: A rhizome is a modified stem that grows horizontally underground and has nodes and internodes .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Vertical shoots may arise from the buds on the rhizome of some plants , such as ginger and ferns .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1149 . Stolons are stems that run almost parallel to the ground , or just below the surface , and can give rise to new plants at the nodes .

Subject: biology

Sentence: 1155 . Dicots have a tap root system , while monocots have a fibrous root system .

Sentence: 1206 . Plants require only light , water and about 20 elements to support all their biochemical needs : these 20 elements are called essential nutrients ( [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: For an element to be regarded as essential , three criteria are required : 1 ) a plant can not complete its life cycle without the element ; 2 ) no other element can perform the function of the element ; and 3 ) the element is directly involved in plant nutrition .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1209 . Plants obtain inorganic elements from the soil , which serves as a natural medium for land plants .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Soil is the outer loose layer that covers the surface of Earth .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Soil quality is a major determinant , along with climate , of plant distribution and growth .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1212 . The inorganic material of soil consists of rock , slowly broken down into smaller particles that vary in size .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Soil particles that are 0.1 to 2 mm in diameter are sand .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Soil particles between 0.002 and 0.1 mm are called silt , and even smaller particles , less than 0.002 mm in diameter , are called clay .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1215 . Soil distribution is not homogenous because its formation results in the production of layers ; together , the vertical section of a soil is called the soil profile .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Within the soil profile , soil scientists define zones called horizons .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1218 . The organic and inorganic material in which soils form is the parent material .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Mineral soils form directly from the weathering of bedrock , the solid rock that lies beneath the soil , and therefore , they have a similar composition to the original rock .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Other soils form in materials that came from elsewhere , such as sand and glacial drift .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1221 . Topsoil is rich in organic material ; microbial processes occur there , and it is the “ workhorse ” of plant production .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The A horizon consists of a mixture of organic material with inorganic products of weathering , and it is therefore the beginning of true mineral soil .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This horizon is typically darkly colored because of the presence of organic matter .

Subject: biology

Subject: biology

Sentence: 1266 . Forest fires also lead to the emergence of new seedlings .

Sentence: This guarantees that seeds produced by plants in temperate climates will not germinate until the spring .

Subject: biology

Sentence: Young stems that can be bent easily without any injury are preferred .

Sentence: 1281 . Soon after flowering , these plants die .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1287 . The insulation used to conserve the body heat comes in the forms of fur , fat , or feathers .

Sentence: The absence of insulation in ectothermic animals increases their dependence on the environment for body heat .

Sentence: 1293 . A sagittal plane divides the body into right and left portions .
