Subject: biology
Sentence: A frontal plane ( also called a coronal plane ) separates the front from the back .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1302 . Columnar epithelial cells are taller than they are wide : they resemble a stack of columns in an epithelial layer , and are most commonly found in a single - layer arrangement .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The nuclei of columnar epithelial cells in the digestive tract appear to be lined up at the base of the cells , as illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1305 . Connective TissuesConnective tissues are made up of a matrix consisting of living cells and a non - living substance , called the ground substance .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The ground substance is made of an organic substance ( usually a protein ) and an inorganic substance ( usually a mineral or water ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1308 . Fibrous connective tissues contain large amounts of collagen fibers and few cells or matrix material .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The fibers can be arranged irregularly or regularly with the strands lined up in parallel .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1311 . The cells , called chondrocytes , make the matrix and fibers of the tissue .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Chondrocytes are found in spaces within the tissue called lacunae .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1314 . The wavy lines seen between the lacunae are microchannels called canaliculi ; they connect the lacunae to aid diffusion between the cells .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Spongy bone is made of tiny plates called trabeculae these plates serve as struts to give the spongy bone strength .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Over time , these plates can break causing the bone to become less resilient .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1317 . Any homeostatic process that changes the direction of the stimulus is a negative feedback loop .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It may either increase or decrease the stimulus , but the stimulus is not allowed to continue as it did before the receptor sensed it .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1320 . Changes can be made in a group of body organ systems in order to maintain a set point in another system .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This is called acclimatization .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This occurs , for instance , when an animal migrates to a higher altitude than it is accustomed to .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1323 . Carnivores are animals that eat other animals .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The word carnivore is derived from Latin and literally means “ meat eater . ”

Subject: biology
Sentence: Wild cats such as lions , shown in [ link ] a and tigers are examples of vertebrate carnivores , as are snakes and sharks , while invertebrate carnivores include sea stars , spiders , and ladybugs , shown in [ link ] b .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1326 . The alimentary canal , shown in [ link ] b , is a more advanced system : it consists of one tube with a mouth at one end and an anus at the other .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Earthworms are an example of an animal with an alimentary canal .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1329 . Ruminants are mainly herbivores like cows , sheep , and goats , whose entire diet consists of eating large amounts of roughage or fiber .

Subject: biology
Sentence: They have evolved digestive systems that help them digest vast amounts of cellulose .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1332 . The lingual lipase begins the breakdown of fat components in the food .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The chewing and wetting action provided by the teeth and saliva prepare the food into a mass called the bolus for swallowing .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The tongue helps in swallowing — moving the bolus from the mouth into the pharynx .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1335 . A ring - like muscle called a sphincter forms valves in the digestive system .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The gastro - esophageal sphincter is located at the stomach end of the esophagus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1338 . Contraction and relaxation of smooth muscles mixes the stomach contents about every 20 minutes .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The partially digested food and gastric juice mixture is called chyme .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Chyme passes from the stomach to the small intestine .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1341 . The human small intestine is over 6 m long and is divided into three parts : the duodenum , the jejunum , and the ileum .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The “ C - shaped , ” fixed part of the small intestine is called the duodenum and is shown in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The duodenum is separated from the stomach by the pyloric sphincter which opens to allow chyme to move from the stomach to the duodenum .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1344 . Here , hydrolysis of nutrients is continued while most of the carbohydrates and amino acids are absorbed through the intestinal lining .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The bulk of chemical digestion and nutrient absorption occurs in the jejunum .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The ileum , also illustrated in [ link ] is the last part of the small intestine and here the bile salts and vitamins are absorbed into blood stream .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The undigested food is sent to the colon from the ileum via peristaltic movements of the muscle .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1347 . The feces are propelled using peristaltic movements during elimination .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The anus is an opening at the far - end of the digestive tract and is the exit point for the waste material .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Two sphincters between the rectum and anus control elimination : the inner sphincter is involuntary and the outer sphincter is voluntary .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1350 . The gallbladder is a small organ that aids the liver by storing bile and concentrating bile salts .

Subject: biology
Sentence: When chyme containing fatty acids enters the duodenum , the bile is secreted from the gallbladder into the duodenum .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1353 . Both fat - soluble and water - soluble vitamins must be obtained from food .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Minerals , listed in [ link ] , are inorganic essential nutrients that must be obtained from food .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Among their many functions , minerals help in structure and regulation and are considered co - factors .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1356 . Pancreatic juices also contain amylase , which continues the breakdown of starch and glycogen into maltose , a disaccharide .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The disaccharides are broken down into monosaccharides by enzymes called maltases , sucrases , and lactases , which are also present in the brush border of the small intestinal wall .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Maltase breaks down maltose into glucose .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1359 . The long - chain fatty acids and monoglycerides recombine in the absorptive cells to form triglycerides , which aggregate into globules and become coated with proteins .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These large spheres are called chylomicrons .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Chylomicrons contain triglycerides , cholesterol , and other lipids and have proteins on their surface .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1362 . The intestinal phase begins when chyme enters the small intestine triggering digestive secretions .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This phase controls the rate of gastric emptying .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1365 . Gastrin stimulates the release of stomach acid , or hydrochloric acid ( HCl ) which aids in the digestion of the proteins .

Subject: biology
Sentence: However , when the stomach is emptied , the acidic environment need not be maintained and a hormone called somatostatin stops the release of hydrochloric acid .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This is controlled by a negative feedback mechanism .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1368 . Foods high in lipids take a long time to digest .

Subject: biology
Sentence: A hormone called gastric inhibitory peptide is secreted by the small intestine to slow down the peristaltic movements of the intestine to allow fatty foods more time to be digested and absorbed .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1371 . Once a signal is received by the dendrite , it then travels passively to the cell body .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The cell body contains a specialized structure , the axon hillock that integrates signals from multiple synapses and serves as a junction between the cell body and an axon .

Subject: biology
Sentence: An axon is a tube - like structure that propagates the integrated signal to specialized endings called axon terminals .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1374 . Along the axon there are periodic gaps in the myelin sheath .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These gaps are called nodes of Ranvier and are sites where the signal is “ recharged ” as it travels along the axon .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1377 . Satellite glia provide nutrients and structural support for neurons in the PNS .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Microglia scavenge and degrade dead cells and protect the brain from invading microorganisms .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Oligodendrocytes , shown in [ link ] b form myelin sheaths around axons in the CNS .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1380 . This is distinctive from the PNS where a single Schwann cell provides myelin for only one axon as the entire Schwann cell surrounds the axon .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Radial glia serve as scaffolds for developing neurons as they migrate to their end destinations .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Ependymal cells line fluid - filled ventricles of the brain and the central canal of the spinal cord .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1383 . Transmission of a signal between neurons is generally carried by a chemical called a neurotransmitter .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Transmission of a signal within a neuron ( from dendrite to axon terminal ) is carried by a brief reversal of the resting membrane potential called an action potential .

Subject: biology
Sentence: When neurotransmitter molecules bind to receptors located on a neuron ’s dendrites , ion channels open .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1386 . As K+ ions leave the cell , the membrane potential once again becomes negative .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The diffusion of K+ out of the cell actually hyperpolarizes the cell , in that the membrane potential becomes more negative than the cell 's normal resting potential .

Subject: biology
Sentence: At this point , the sodium channels will return to their resting state , meaning they are ready to open again if the membrane potential again exceeds the threshold potential .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1389 . Fusion of a vesicle with the presynaptic membrane causes neurotransmitter to be released into the synaptic cleft , the extracellular space between the presynaptic and postsynaptic membranes , as illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The neurotransmitter diffuses across the synaptic cleft and binds to receptor proteins on the postsynaptic membrane .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1392 . Signal SummationSometimes a single EPSP is strong enough to induce an action potential in the postsynaptic neuron , but often multiple presynaptic inputs must create EPSPs around the same time for the postsynaptic neuron to be sufficiently depolarized to fire an action potential .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This process is called summation and occurs at the axon hillock , as illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Additionally , one neuron often has inputs from many presynaptic neurons — some excitatory and some inhibitory — so IPSPs can cancel out EPSPs and vice versa .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1395 . The central nervous system ( CNS ) is made up of the brain , a part of which is shown in [ link ] and spinal cord and is covered with three layers of protective coverings called meninges ( from the Greek word for membrane ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The outermost layer is the dura mater ( Latin for “ hard mother ” ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1398 . The middle layer is the web - like arachnoid mater .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The last layer is the pia mater ( Latin for “ soft mother ” ) , which directly contacts and covers the brain and spinal cord like plastic wrap .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The space between the arachnoid and pia maters is filled with cerebrospinal fluid ( CSF ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1401 . It includes the cerebral cortex , limbic system , basal ganglia , thalamus , hypothalamus , and cerebellum .

Subject: biology
Sentence: There are three different ways that a brain can be sectioned in order to view internal structures : a sagittal section cuts the brain left to right , as shown in [ link ] b , a coronal section cuts the brain front to back , as shown in [ link ] a , and a horizontal section cuts the brain top to bottom . Cerebral CortexThe outermost part of the brain is a thick piece of nervous system tissue called the cerebral cortex , which is folded into hills called gyri ( singular : gyrus ) and valleys called sulci ( singular : sulcus ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The cortex is made up of two hemispheres — right and left — which are separated by a large sulcus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1404 . The parietal lobe is located at the top of the brain .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Neurons in the parietal lobe are involved in speech and also reading .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1407 . The temporal lobe is located at the base of the brain by your ears and is primarily involved in processing and interpreting sounds .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It also contains the hippocampus ( Greek for “ seahorse ” ) — a structure that processes memory formation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1410 . The thalamus ( Greek for “ inner chamber ” ) , illustrated in [ link ] , acts as a gateway to and from the cortex .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It receives sensory and motor inputs from the body and also receives feedback from the cortex .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1413 . It plays a role in memory formation and includes parts of the thalamus and hypothalamus as well as the hippocampus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: One important structure within the limbic system is a temporal lobe structure called the amygdala ( Greek for “ almond ” ) , illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The two amygdala are important both for the sensation of fear and for recognizing fearful faces .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1416 . The brainstem , illustrated in [ link ] , connects the rest of the brain with the spinal cord .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It consists of the midbrain , medulla oblongata , and the pons .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1419 . The sympathetic nervous system is responsible for the “ fight or flight ” response that occurs when an animal encounters a dangerous situation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: One way to remember this is to think of the surprise a person feels when encountering a snake ( “ snake ” and “ sympathetic ” both begin with “ s ” ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1422 . While the sympathetic nervous system is activated in stressful situations , the parasympathetic nervous system allows an animal to “ rest and digest . ”

Subject: biology
Sentence: One way to remember this is to think that during a restful situation like a picnic , the parasympathetic nervous system is in control ( “ picnic ” and “ parasympathetic ” both start with “ p ” ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Parasympathetic preganglionic neurons have cell bodies located in the brainstem and in the sacral ( toward the bottom ) spinal cord , as shown in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1425 . Neurodegenerative disorders are illnesses characterized by a loss of nervous system functioning that are usually caused by neuronal death .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These diseases generally worsen over time as more and more neurons die .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1428 . Autism spectrum disorder ( ASD ) is a neurodevelopmental disorder .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Its severity differs from person to person .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1431 . Major depression affects approximately 6.7 percent of the adults in the United States each year and is one of the most common mental disorders .

Subject: biology
Sentence: To be diagnosed with major depressive disorder , a person must have experienced a severely depressed mood lasting longer than two weeks along with other symptoms including a loss of enjoyment in activities that were previously enjoyed , changes in appetite and sleep schedules , difficulty concentrating , feelings of worthlessness , and suicidal thoughts .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1434 . Although the sensory systems associated with these senses are very different , all share a common function : to convert a stimulus ( such as light , or sound , or the position of the body ) into an electrical signal in the nervous system .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This process is called sensory transduction . There are two broad types of cellular systems that perform sensory transduction .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In one , a neuron works with a sensory receptor , a cell , or cell process that is specialized to engage with and detect a specific stimulus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1437 . The receptor can then respond to the stimuli .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The region in space in which a given sensory receptor can respond to a stimulus , be it far away or in contact with the body , is that receptor ’s receptive field .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Think for a moment about the differences in receptive fields for the different senses .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1440 . Perception is an individual ’s interpretation of a sensation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Although perception relies on the activation of sensory receptors , perception happens not at the level of the sensory receptor , but at higher levels in the nervous system , in the brain .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1443 . Meissner ’s corpuscles , ( shown in [ link ] ) also known as tactile corpuscles , are found in the upper dermis , but they project into the epidermis .

Subject: biology
Sentence: They , too , are found primarily in the glabrous skin on the fingertips and eyelids .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1446 . Neurons are not physically connected , but communicate via neurotransmitters secreted into synapses or “ gaps ” between communicating neurons .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Once in the medulla , the neurons continue carrying the signals to the thalamus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Muscle spindles are stretch receptors that detect the amount of stretch , or lengthening of muscles .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Related to these are Golgi tendon organs , which are tension receptors that detect the force of muscle contraction .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1449 . Audition , or hearing , is important to humans and to other animals for many different interactions .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It enables an organism to detect and receive information about danger , such as an approaching predator , and to participate in communal exchanges like those concerning territories or mating .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1452 . In mammals , sound waves are collected by the external , cartilaginous part of the ear called the pinna , then travel through the auditory canal and cause vibration of the thin diaphragm called the tympanum or ear drum , the innermost part of the outer ear ( illustrated in [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Interior to the tympanum is the middle ear .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The middle ear holds three small bones called the ossicles , which transfer energy from the moving tympanum to the inner ear .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1455 . The mechanical energy from the moving tympanum transmits the vibrations to the three bones of the middle ear .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The stapes transmits the vibrations to a thin diaphragm called the oval window , which is the outermost structure of the inner ear .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The structures of the inner ear are found in the labyrinth , a bony , hollow structure that is the most interior portion of the ear .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1458 . The cochlea is a whorled structure , like the shell of a snail , and it contains receptors for transduction of the mechanical wave into an electrical signal ( as illustrated in [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Inside the cochlea , the basilar membrane is a mechanical analyzer that runs the length of the cochlea , curling toward the cochlea ’s center .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1461 . The site of transduction is in the organ of Corti ( spiral organ ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It is composed of hair cells held in place above the basilar membrane like flowers projecting up from soil , with their exposed short , hair - like stereocilia contacting or embedded in the tectorial membrane above them .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The inner hair cells are the primary auditory receptors and exist in a single row , numbering approximately 3,500 .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1464 . Wave amplitude is perceived as luminous intensity , or brightness .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The standard unit of intensity of light is the candela , which is approximately the luminous intensity of a one common candle .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1467 . The cornea , the front transparent layer of the eye , and the crystalline lens , a transparent convex structure behind the cornea , both refract ( bend ) light to focus the image on the retina .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The iris , which is conspicuous as the colored part of the eye , is a circular muscular ring lying between the lens and cornea that regulates the amount of light entering the eye .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In conditions of high ambient light , the iris contracts , reducing the size of the pupil at its center .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1470 . For both defects , images in the distance are clear but images nearby are blurry .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Myopia ( nearsightedness ) occurs when an eyeball is elongated and the image focus falls in front of the retina .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In this case , images in the distance are blurry but images nearby are clear .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1473 . Both rods and cones contain photopigments .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In vertebrates , the main photopigment , rhodopsin , has two main parts [ link ] ) : an opsin , which is a membrane protein ( in the form of a cluster of α - helices that span the membrane ) , and retinal — a molecule that absorbs light .

Subject: biology
Sentence: When light hits a photoreceptor , it causes a shape change in the retinal , altering its structure from a bent ( cis ) form of the molecule to its linear ( trans ) isomer .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1476 . Another important visual route is a pathway from the retina to the superior colliculus in the midbrain , where eye movements are coordinated and integrated with auditory information .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Finally , there is the pathway from the retina to the suprachiasmatic nucleus ( SCN ) of the hypothalamus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The SCN is a cluster of cells that is considered to be the body ’s internal clock , which controls our circadian ( day - long ) cycle .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1479 . The first four tastes need little explanation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The identification of umami as a fundamental taste occurred fairly recently — it was identified in 1908 by Japanese scientist Kikunae Ikeda while he worked with seaweed broth , but it was not widely accepted as a taste that could be physiologically distinguished until many years later .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The taste of umami , also known as savoriness , is attributable to the taste of the amino acid L - glutamate .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1482 . Recall that sensory cells are neurons .

Subject: biology
Sentence: An olfactory receptor , which is a dendrite of a specialized neuron , responds when it binds certain molecules inhaled from the environment by sending impulses directly to the olfactory bulb of the brain .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Humans have about 12 million olfactory receptors , distributed among hundreds of different receptor types that respond to different odors .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1485 . The primary organ of taste is the taste bud .

Subject: biology
Sentence: A taste bud is a cluster of gustatory receptors ( taste cells ) that are located within the bumps on the tongue called papillae ( singular : papilla ) ( illustrated in [ link ] ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: There are several structurally distinct papillae .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1488 . Most lipid hormones are derived from cholesterol and thus are structurally similar to it , as illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The primary class of lipid hormones in humans is the steroid hormones .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1491 . The structure of peptide hormones is that of a polypeptide chain ( chain of amino acids ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The peptide hormones include molecules that are short polypeptide chains , such as antidiuretic hormone and oxytocin produced in the brain and released into the blood in the posterior pituitary gland .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1494 . In up - regulation , the number of receptors increases in response to rising hormone levels , making the cell more sensitive to the hormone and allowing for more cellular activity .

Subject: biology
Sentence: When the number of receptors decreases in response to rising hormone levels , called down - regulation , cellular activity is reduced .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1497 . In this way , nothing passes through the cell membrane ; the hormone that binds at the surface remains at the surface of the cell while the intracellular product remains inside the cell .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The hormone that initiates the signaling pathway is called a first messenger , which activates a second messenger in the cytoplasm , as illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1500 . In this way , a small amount of hormone can trigger the formation of a large amount of cellular product .

Subject: biology
Sentence: To stop hormone activity , cAMP is deactivated by the cytoplasmic enzyme phosphodiesterase , or PDE .

Subject: biology
Sentence: PDE is always present in the cell and breaks down cAMP to control hormone activity , preventing overproduction of cellular products . The specific response of a cell to a lipid insoluble hormone depends on the type of receptors that are present on the cell membrane and the substrate molecules present in the cell cytoplasm .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1503 . In some cases , the nervous system directly stimulates endocrine glands to release hormones , which is referred to as neural stimuli .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Recall that in a short - term stress response , the hormones epinephrine and norepinephrine are important for providing the bursts of energy required for the body to respond .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1506 . The hypothalamus contains autonomic centers that control endocrine cells in the adrenal medulla via neuronal control . The pituitary gland , sometimes called the hypophysis or “ master gland ” is located at the base of the brain in the sella turcica , a groove of the sphenoid bone of the skull , illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It is attached to the hypothalamus via a stalk called the pituitary stalk ( or infundibulum ) .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The anterior portion of the pituitary gland is regulated by releasing or release - inhibiting hormones produced by the hypothalamus , and the posterior pituitary receives signals via neurosecretory cells to release hormones produced by the hypothalamus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1509 . The posterior pituitary is significantly different in structure from the anterior pituitary .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It is a part of the brain , extending down from the hypothalamus , and contains mostly nerve fibers and neuroglial cells , which support axons that extend from the hypothalamus to the posterior pituitary .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1512 . The thyroid gland is made up of many spherical thyroid follicles , which are lined with a simple cuboidal epithelium .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These follicles contain a viscous fluid , called colloid , which stores the glycoprotein thyroglobulin , the precursor to the thyroid hormones .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The follicles produce hormones that can be stored in the colloid or released into the surrounding capillary network for transport to the rest of the body via the circulatory system .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1515 . The adrenal glands are associated with the kidneys ; one gland is located on top of each kidney as illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The adrenal glands consist of an outer adrenal cortex and an inner adrenal medulla .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1518 . The pancreas , illustrated in [ link ] , is an elongated organ that is located between the stomach and the proximal portion of the small intestine .

Subject: biology
Sentence: It contains both exocrine cells that excrete digestive enzymes and endocrine cells that release hormones .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1521 . The heart possesses endocrine cells in the walls of the atria that are specialized cardiac muscle cells .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These cells release the hormone atrial natriuretic peptide ( ANP ) in response to increased blood volume .

Subject: biology
Sentence: High blood volume causes the cells to be stretched , resulting in hormone release .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1524 . EPO has been used by athletes to improve performance , as greater oxygen delivery to muscle cells allows for greater endurance .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Because red blood cells increase the viscosity of blood , artificially high levels of EPO can cause severe health risks . The thymus is found behind the sternum ; it is most prominent in infants , becoming smaller in size through adulthood .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The thymus produces hormones referred to as thymosins , which contribute to the development of the immune response .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1527 . The hypothalamus produces a polypeptide hormone known as antidiuretic hormone ( ADH ) , which is transported to and released from the posterior pituitary gland .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The principal action of ADH is to regulate the amount of water excreted by the kidneys .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1530 . In contrast to ADH , which promotes the reabsorption of water to maintain proper water balance , aldosterone maintains proper water balance by enhancing Na+ reabsorption and K+ secretion from extracellular fluid of the cells in kidney tubules .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Because it is produced in the cortex of the adrenal gland and affects the concentrations of minerals Na+ and K+ , aldosterone is referred to as a mineralocorticoid , a corticosteroid that affects ion and water balance .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Aldosterone release is stimulated by a decrease in blood sodium levels , blood volume , or blood pressure , or an increase in blood potassium levels .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1533 . During puberty in both males and females , the hypothalamus produces gonadotropin - releasing hormone ( GnRH ) , which stimulates the production and release of follicle - stimulating hormone ( FSH ) and luteinizing hormone ( LH ) from the anterior pituitary gland .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These hormones regulate the gonads ( testes in males and ovaries in females ) and therefore are called gonadotropins .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In both males and females , FSH stimulates gamete production and LH stimulates production of hormones by the gonads .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1536 . Prolactin stimulates the production of milk by the mammary glands following childbirth .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Prolactin levels are regulated by the hypothalamic hormones prolactin - releasing hormone ( PRH ) and prolactin - inhibiting hormone ( PIH ) , which is now known to be dopamine .

Subject: biology
Sentence: PRH stimulates the release of prolactin and PIH inhibits it . The posterior pituitary releases the hormone oxytocin , which stimulates uterine contractions during childbirth .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1539 . Impaired insulin function can lead to a condition called diabetes mellitus , the main symptoms of which are illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This can be caused by low levels of insulin production by the beta cells of the pancreas , or by reduced sensitivity of tissue cells to insulin .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1545 . The basal metabolic rate , which is the amount of calories required by the body at rest , is determined by two hormones produced by the thyroid gland : thyroxine , also known as tetraiodothyronine or T4 , and triiodothyronine , also known as T3 .

Subject: biology
Sentence: These hormones affect nearly every cell in the body except for the adult brain , uterus , testes , blood cells , and spleen .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1548 . Inadequate iodine intake , which occurs in many developing countries , results in an inability to synthesize T3 and T4 hormones .

Subject: biology
Sentence: The thyroid gland enlarges in a condition called goiter , which is caused by overproduction of TSH without the formation of thyroid hormone .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Thyroglobulin is contained in a fluid called colloid , and TSH stimulation results in higher levels of colloid accumulation in the thyroid .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1551 . Blood calcium levels are regulated by parathyroid hormone ( PTH ) , which is produced by the parathyroid glands , as illustrated in [ link ] .

Subject: biology
Sentence: PTH is released in response to low blood Ca2 + levels .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1554 . This results in a switch by most tissues from utilizing glucose as an energy source to utilizing fatty acids .

Subject: biology
Sentence: This process is called a glucose - sparing effect .

Subject: biology
Sentence: In another direct mechanism , GH stimulates glycogen breakdown in the liver ; the glycogen is then released into the blood as glucose .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1557 . A balanced production of growth hormone is critical for proper development .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Underproduction of GH in adults does not appear to cause any abnormalities , but in children it can result in pituitary dwarfism , in which growth is reduced .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Pituitary dwarfism is characterized by symmetric body formation .

Subject: biology
Sentence: 1560 . The sympathetic nervous system regulates the stress response via the hypothalamus .

Subject: biology
Sentence: Stressful stimuli cause the hypothalamus to signal the adrenal medulla ( which mediates short - term stress responses ) via nerve impulses , and the adrenal cortex , which mediates long - term stress responses , via the hormone adrenocorticotropic hormone ( ACTH ) , which is produced by the anterior pituitary .
